meanings.definition: A place where old or discarded metal, machinery, or other items are collected and stored for recycling or disposal.
meanings.sent1: The scrapyard was filled with rusted cars and broken appliances.
meanings.sent2: My uncle works at the local scrapyard, sorting through piles of metal.
meanings.sent3: When the robot dance competition ended, the robots all headed to the scrapyard to retire.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a cluttered scrapyard, full of old memories and forgotten dreams.
meanings.sent5: The sun glinted off the metal in the scrapyard, creating a dazzling display of light and shadow.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to scrapyard these old magazines cluttering my room.
meanings.sent2: After the party, we decided to scrapyard the leftover food.
meanings.sent3: She scrapyarded her outdated wardrobe and embraced a minimalist style.
meanings.sent4: The company had to scrapyard the faulty products to maintain quality standards.
meanings.sent5: He had to scrapyard his old habits to make room for personal growth.
